intro: Addisonia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
